intro: Micromeria croatica f. linearilanceolata, commonly known as the Croatian micromeria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic compounds. The plant features narrow, lanceolate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky and calcareous soils, often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss.
